snippet: The Hungarian director Bela Tarr has made what he is calling his final film, “The Turin Horse,” a black-and-white tale of medieval adversity and survival.
abstract: Hungarian director Bela Tarr has made what he is calling his final film, The Turin Horse, a black-and-white tale of medieval adversity and survival; says he wants to make certain that he avoids what he always feared would be his fate as a filmmaker: repeating himself.
lead_paragraph: The Hungarian director Bela Tarr has made what he is calling his final film, “The Turin Horse,” a black-and-white tale of medieval adversity and survival.

headline.seo: Bela Tarr Says ‘The Turin Horse’ Is His Last Movie
headline.main: In Auteur’s Swan Song, an Ode to Survival
